author: Special Correspondent
text:
Initiative is a part of National Volunteering Week of Yi

The members of the Young Indians and NSS volunteers from Sona College of Technology cleaning the compound wall of the Salem Railway Junction on Tuesday.

The Young Indians (Yi) of the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) launched Salem Railway Junction beautification campaign here on Tuesday. The campaign was part of the National Volunteering Week of the Yi.

Walls whitewashed

The members of the Yi along with the volunteers of the Nehru Yuva Kendra and NSS unit of Sona College of Technology cleaned the junction wall near the city bus stop for the whole day. They whitewashed the wall and displayed social messages.

The National Volunteering Week is an initiative under “India@75” to motivate the people to contribute in terms of their time and skill towards making a difference in the lives of fellow citizens and unleash a revolution driven by the ethos of selfless service.

Selvaraj, Deputy Station Master-Commercial, Salem Railway Junction, inaugurated the campaign and commended the initiative of the Yi and other volunteers to beautify the railway station premises. V. Aravinthan, Chair, Yi Salem chapter, was also present.
title: Young Indians launch campaign to beautify Salem railway junction
